body.p: Hence, the Board saw no advantage in defining two separate types of asset, one described in financial statements as a resource (for example, in cases of full legal ownership of a physical object) and the other described as a right (all other rights over all or part of a resource). Nevertheless, the 2018 Conceptual Framework notes in paragraph 4.12 that describing the set of rights as the physical object will often provide a faithful representation of those rights in the most concise and understandable way.
